t: Hallelujah!*pn I*ln will praise the Lord*s with all my heart in*ln the assembly of the upright and in the congregation.
The*ln Lord’s*s works are great, studied*ln by all who delight in them.
All*ln that he does is splendid and majestic; his*ln righteousness endures forever.
He*ln has caused his wondrous works to be remembered. The*ln Lord*s is gracious and compassionate.
He*ln has provided food for those who fear him; he*ln remembers his covenant forever.
He*ln has shown his people the power of his works by*ln giving them the inheritance of the nations.
The*ln works of his hands are truth and justice; all*ln his instructions are trustworthy.
They*ln are established forever and ever, enacted*ln in truth and in uprightness.
He*ln has sent redemption to his people. He*ln has ordained his covenant forever. His*ln name is holy and awe-inspiring.
The*pn fear of the Lord*s is the beginning of wisdom; all*ln who follow his instructions have good insight. His*ln praise endures forever.
